definition: female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
(of a bird, animal or plant) female/keyhole/valley
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute
(of a bird, animal or plant) male/key/hills
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests
lit. a dog who catches mice (idiom)/fig. to be meddlesome
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
thinking and pondering (idiom); to turn sth over in one's mind/to consider repeatedly
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
lit. rat in a country shrine, fox on town walls; fig. unprincipled thugs who abuse others' power to bully and exploit people
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
has eyes but can't see (idiom); unable or unwilling to see the importance of sth/blind (to sth great)
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
cow
common saying/folk proverb
